title: Add command for simplifying CLAUDE.md
description:
Add a slash command that analyzes and simplifies CLAUDE.md files (both global ~/.claude/CLAUDE.md and project-level). The command should:

1. Read the target CLAUDE.md file(s)
2. Identify redundancies: instructions that duplicate Claude's default behavior, overly verbose explanations, repeated concepts across sections
3. Identify conflicts: instructions that contradict each other or contradict defaults
4. Identify dead weight: instructions about features/patterns no longer in use, references to nonexistent files or tools
5. Suggest a simplified version that preserves all meaningful intent in fewer lines
6. Present a diff of proposed changes for user approval before applying
7. Support --dry-run to show suggestions without modifying anything

Goal: keep CLAUDE.md files concise and high-signal. Lines after 200 in memory files get truncated, and verbose instructions waste context window. Every line should earn its place.

title: Add command for bulk reviewing all code with reviewer (and optionally adding to beads)
description:
Add a slash command that bulk-reviews an entire codebase (or a specified directory/glob) using the existing code-reviewer subagent. The command should:

1. Accept a target path or glob pattern (default: entire repo)
2. Discover all reviewable files, grouped by language (Go, Python, JS/TS, React, Shell)
3. Spawn parallel code-reviewer subagents per file or logical group, loading the appropriate language guideline from ~/.claude/guidelines/
4. Aggregate results into a unified report with three-tier feedback (Critical / Warning / Suggestion)
5. Optionally create beads issues for findings above a configurable severity threshold (e.g. --beads=warnings creates issues for criticals and warnings)
6. Support a --format flag for output (terminal summary, markdown file, or JSON)

The slash command should follow the existing pattern in claude/commands/ with YAML frontmatter and staged workflow. It should respect the existing code-reviewer agent's review standards and comment bar.

title: Add code architecture reviewer
description:
Add a code-reviewer variant agent focused on architecture and design quality. The agent should analyze:

1. Dependency structure: circular dependencies, inappropriate coupling between layers/packages, dependency direction violations
2. Module cohesion: files/packages that mix unrelated responsibilities, god objects/files, feature envy
3. API surface: overly broad interfaces, leaky abstractions, inconsistent API patterns across the codebase
4. Code organization: files in wrong directories, inconsistent naming across modules, orphaned/dead code paths
5. Design pattern usage: misapplied patterns, opportunities for well-established patterns that would reduce complexity

For each finding, provide: the issue, why it matters for maintainability, and a concrete refactoring suggestion.

Implementation: create a new agent definition in claude/agents/ following the existing pattern (YAML frontmatter, tools: Read/Grep/Glob/Bash). Create a corresponding slash command in claude/commands/ that invokes it. Should work across Go, Python, JS/TS codebases.

title: Add slash command for finding testing gaps in code (and optionally adding to beads)
description:
Add a slash command that analyzes a codebase to identify testing gaps. The command should:

1. Accept a target path or glob pattern (default: entire repo)
2. Discover all source files and their corresponding test files using common conventions (e.g. foo.go -> foo_test.go, bar.py -> test_bar.py, baz.ts -> baz.test.ts)
3. Identify files with no corresponding tests at all
4. For files with tests, use a subagent to analyze coverage gaps: untested functions, missing edge cases, untested error paths, missing integration scenarios
5. Produce a prioritized report: files with no tests first, then files with significant gaps, then minor suggestions
6. Optionally create beads issues for the gaps (--beads flag), grouped logically (one issue per file or per module)
7. Support filtering by language or directory

Should follow the existing slash command pattern in claude/commands/ with YAML frontmatter and staged workflow.

title: Add cognitive complexity reviewer
description:
Add a code-reviewer variant agent focused specifically on cognitive complexity. The agent should:

1. Analyze functions/methods for cognitive complexity using established metrics (similar to SonarQube's cognitive complexity model): nesting depth, control flow breaks, boolean operator chains, recursion, etc.
2. Flag functions exceeding a configurable threshold (default: 15)
3. For each flagged function, suggest specific refactoring strategies: extract method, replace conditional with polymorphism, early returns, lookup tables, etc.
4. Provide a file-level and repo-level summary with hotspots ranked by complexity score

Implementation: create a new agent definition in claude/agents/ following the existing pattern (YAML frontmatter, tools: Read/Grep/Glob/Bash). Create a corresponding slash command in claude/commands/ that invokes it. The agent should be language-aware and load appropriate guidelines from ~/.claude/guidelines/.
